cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: near Cape Hatteras, North Carolina (about 10 miles WSW of the cape)
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, skirting the Outer Banks today then moving farther offshore toward Nova Scotia during the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Cape Hatteras, NC (brush/landfall along the Outer Banks)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – North Carolina/Virginia border to Fenwick Island DE, including lower Chesapeake Bay; Storm Surge Warning – Salter Path NC to Poquoson VA including Hampton Roads
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hampton Roads and the lower Chesapeake Bay coastline of southeast Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) expected Friday, diminishing Friday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Hampton Roads and the lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–8 inches of rain could lead to flash flooding in far southeast Virginia
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible Friday
